posts.post_content:
So now we have precedent for letting multicolor cards in the core sets. GOOD. Time to start sniffing through the Invasion, Ravnica, and Shards of Alara blocks for candidates for uncommon and rare cycles in M14.  
  
This card ALSO means we won't need the kind of reminder text that was on [Marsh Goblins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marsh Goblins), [Dark Heart of the Wood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Heart of the Wood) (The Dark version only), and [Scarwood Goblins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scarwood Goblins).
posts.html:
So now we have precedent for letting multicolor cards in the core sets. GOOD. Time to start sniffing through the Invasion, Ravnica, and Shards of Alara blocks for candidates for uncommon and rare cycles in M14.

posts.post_content:
Opening Hand  
[Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker)  
[Channel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Channel)  
[Kaleidostone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaleidostone)  
[Elvish Spirit Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Spirit Guide)  
  
and either a [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) or another [Kaleidostone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaleidostone) to generate the final black mana and you can have him out turn 1. I know it's an absurd combination of cards, but it's fun to dream and hypothesize.

If your deck is looking to go big, might as well go the biggest and most glorious there is.

Posted By: TheDarkLight (12/17/2012 7:29:40 AM)

posts.post_content:
So let's see..  
+3: Kill anything, except creatures. Lord Bolas will not tolerate other people having nice things.  
-2: Steal creature. Because while Bolas hates you, He is not wasteful.  
-9: Screw you.  
If he hits the table, and you can avoid dying immediately, he helps you get so far ahead it's not even funny. Land, enchantments, artifacts, all go away.   
Oh you wanted to swing with your [Sun Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sun Titan)? Nope.  
not to mention his last effect is just devastating in every way. It's pretty much over if you hit someone with it.

Posted By: AwkwardInvasion (12/12/2012 1:22:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
His abilities had better have been good! 8 mana, particularly in 3-colours, ISN'T what you'd call "aggressive".  
  
I found that he was the easiest player in the DotP 2013 game, despite being the "end boss"...   
AND HE PLAYED [MOX](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=MOX)S. YOU KNOW, THE EXPENSIVE ONES.   
  
All in all, when M13 was in limited play, he was a weird pick. His $6 price-tag and play-ability in standard (or lack of) wasn't what convinced people to play him. No, people would usually first-pick him JUST IN CASE someone's going grixis colours and might be able to get him out.   
  
Without the Grixis love in Alara, this is and will be a difficult card to get out, always.   
But once you do, oooooh boy. Oh boy. Oh boy oh boy oh boy.
posts.html:

AND HE PLAYED MOXS. YOU KNOW, THE EXPENSIVE ONES.

All in all, when M13 was in limited play, he was a weird pick. His $6 price-tag and play-ability in standard (or lack of) wasn't what convinced people to play him. No, people would usually first-pick him JUST IN CASE someone's going grixis colours and might be able to get him out.

Without the Grixis love in Alara, this is and will be a difficult card to get out, always.
But once you do, oooooh boy. Oh boy. Oh boy oh boy oh boy.

posts.post_content: I've never actually won with him directly. Whenever I drop him my opponent just ends up conceding after I've stripped him of everything he cherishes. There's something downright evil about winning only because your enemy has given up after you've tortured him for three or four turns. The flavour of this card is truly delicious that way. You don't win WITH him, you win BECAUSE of him.
